text: That which was from the beginning, that which we have heard, that which we have seen with our eyes, that which we saw, and our hands touched, concerning the Word of life
speaker: Narrator

text: (and the life was revealed, and we have seen, and testify, and declare to you the life, the eternal life, which was with the Father, and was revealed to us);
speaker: Narrator

text: that which we have seen and heard we declare to you, that you also may have fellowship with us. Yes, and our fellowship is with the Father and with his Son, Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we write these things to you, that our joy may be fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the message which we have heard from him and announce to you, that God is light, and in him is no darkness at all.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we say that we have fellowship with him and walk in the darkness, we lie and don’t tell the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if we walk in the light as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus Christ his Son, cleanses us from all sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and righteous to forgive us the sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we say that we haven’t sinned, we make him a liar, and his word is not in us.
speaker: Narrator

text: My little children, I write these things to you so that you may not sin. If anyone sins, we have a Counselor with the Father, Jesus Christ, the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he is the atoning sacrifice for our sins, and not for ours only, but also for the whole world.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is how we know that we know him: if we keep his commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: One who says, “I know him,” and doesn’t keep his commandments, is a liar, and the truth isn’t in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God’s love has most certainly been perfected in whoever keeps his word. This is how we know that we are in him:
speaker: Narrator

text: he who says he remains in him ought himself also to walk just like he walked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers, I write no new commandment to you, but an old commandment which you had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which you heard from the beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, I write a new commandment to you, which is true in him and in you, because the darkness is passing away and the true light already shines.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who says he is in the light and hates his brother is in the darkness even until now.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who loves his brother remains in the light, and there is no occasion for stumbling in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he who hates his brother is in the darkness, and walks in the darkness, and doesn’t know where he is going, because the darkness has blinded his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: I write to you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his name’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I write to you, fathers, because you know him who is from the beginning.
I write to you, young men, because you have overcome the evil one.
I write to you, little children, because you know the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have written to you, fathers, because you know him who is from the beginning.
I have written to you, young men, because you are strong, and the word of God remains in you, and you have overcome the evil one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t love the world or the things that are in the world. If anyone loves the world, the Father’s love isn’t in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all that is in the world—the lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life—isn’t the Father’s, but is the world’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: The world is passing away with its lusts, but he who does God’s will remains forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Little children, these are the end times, and as you heard that the Antichrist is coming, even now many antichrists have arisen. By this we know that it is the final hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went out from us, but they didn’t belong to us; for if they had belonged to us, they would have continued with us. But they left, that they might be revealed that none of them belong to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have an anointing from the Holy One, and you all have knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not written to you because you don’t know the truth, but because you know it, and because no lie is of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is the liar but he who denies that Jesus is the Christ? This is the Antichrist, he who denies the Father and the Son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever denies the Son doesn’t have the Father. He who confesses the Son has the Father also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, as for you, let that remain in you which you heard from the beginning. If that which you heard from the beginning remains in you, you also will remain in the Son, and in the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the promise which he promised us, the eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things I have written to you concerning those who would lead you astray.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for you, the anointing which you received from him remains in you, and you don’t need for anyone to teach you. But as his anointing teaches you concerning all things, and is true, and is no lie, and even as it taught you, you will remain in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, little children, remain in him, that when he appears, we may have boldness and not be ashamed before him at his coming.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you know that he is righteous, you know that everyone who practices righteousness has been born of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: See how great a love the Father has given to us, that we should be called children of God! For this cause the world doesn’t know us, because it didn’t know him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beloved, now we are children of God. It is not yet revealed what we will be; but we know that when he is revealed, we will be like him, for we will see him just as he is.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who has this hope set on him purifies himself, even as he is pure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who sins also commits lawlessness. Sin is lawlessness.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know that he was revealed to take away our sins, and no sin is in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever remains in him doesn’t sin. Whoever sins hasn’t seen him and doesn’t know him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Little children, let no one lead you astray. He who does righteousness is righteous, even as he is righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who sins is of the devil, for the devil has been sinning from the beginning. To this end the Son of God was revealed: that he might destroy the works of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever is born of God doesn’t commit sin, because his seed remains in him, and he can’t sin, because he is born of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this the children of God are revealed, and the children of the devil. Whoever doesn’t do righteousness is not of God, neither is he who doesn’t love his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is the message which you heard from the beginning, that we should love one another—
speaker: Narrator

text: unlike Cain, who was of the evil one and killed his brother. Why did he kill him? Because his deeds were evil, and his brother’s righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t be surprised, my brothers, if the world hates you.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that we have passed out of death into life, because we love the brothers. He who doesn’t love his brother remains in death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever hates his brother is a murderer, and you know that no murderer has eternal life remaining in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this we know love, because he laid down his life for us. And we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: But whoever has the world’s goods and sees his brother in need, then closes his heart of compassion against him, how does God’s love remain in him?
speaker: Narrator

text: My little children, let’s not love in word only, or with the tongue only, but in deed and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And by this we know that we are of the truth and persuade our hearts before him,
speaker: Narrator

text: because if our heart condemns us, God is greater than our heart, and knows all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beloved, if our hearts don’t condemn us, we have boldness toward God;
speaker: Narrator

text: so whatever we ask, we receive from him, because we keep his commandments and do the things that are pleasing in his sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is his commandment, that we should believe in the name of his Son, Jesus Christ, and love one another, even as he commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who keeps his commandments remains in him, and he in him. By this we know that he remains in us, by the Spirit which he gave us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beloved, don’t believe every spirit, but test the spirits, whether they are of God, because many false prophets have gone out into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this you know the Spirit of God: every spirit who confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: and every spirit who doesn’t confess that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is not of God; and this is the spirit of the Antichrist, of whom you have heard that it comes. Now it is in the world already.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are of God, little children, and have overcome them, because greater is he who is in you than he who is in the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are of the world. Therefore they speak of the world, and the world hears them.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are of God. He who knows God listens to us. He who is not of God doesn’t listen to us. By this we know the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beloved, let’s love one another, for love is of God; and everyone who loves has been born of God and knows God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who doesn’t love doesn’t know God, for God is love.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this God’s love was revealed in us, that God has sent his only born Son into the world that we might live through him.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son as the atoning sacrifice for our sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beloved, if God loved us in this way, we also ought to love one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one has seen God at any time. If we love one another, God remains in us, and his love has been perfected in us.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this we know that we remain in him and he in us, because he has given us of his Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have seen and testify that the Father has sent the Son as the Savior of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever confesses that Jesus is the Son of God, God remains in him, and he in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know and have believed the love which God has for us. God is love, and he who remains in love remains in God, and God remains in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this, love has been made perfect among us, that we may have boldness in the day of judgment, because as he is, even so we are in this world.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no fear in love; but perfect love casts out fear, because fear has punishment. He who fears is not made perfect in love.
speaker: Narrator

text: We love him, because he first loved us.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man says, “I love God,” and hates his brother, he is a liar; for he who doesn’t love his brother whom he has seen, how can he love God whom he has not seen?
speaker: Narrator

text: This commandment we have from him, that he who loves God should also love his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ has been born of God. Whoever loves the Father also loves the child who is born of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God and keep his commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is loving God, that we keep his commandments. His commandments are not grievous.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whatever is born of God overcomes the world. This is the victory that has overcome the world: your faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is he who overcomes the world, but he who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: This is he who came by water and blood, Jesus Christ; not with the water only, but with the water and the blood. It is the Spirit who testifies, because the Spirit is the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there are three who testify:
speaker: Narrator

text: the Spirit, the water, and the blood; and the three agree as one.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we receive the witness of men, the witness of God is greater; for this is God’s testimony which he has testified concerning his Son.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who believes in the Son of God has the testimony in himself. He who doesn’t believe God has made him a liar, because he has not believed in the testimony that God has given concerning his Son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The testimony is this: that God gave to us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who has the Son has the life. He who doesn’t have God’s Son doesn’t have the life.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things I have written to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, that you may know that you have eternal life, and that you may continue to believe in the name of the Son of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the boldness which we have toward him, that if we ask anything according to his will, he listens to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if we know that he listens to us, whatever we ask, we know that we have the petitions which we have asked of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone sees his brother sinning a sin not leading to death, he shall ask, and God will give him life for those who sin not leading to death. There is sin leading to death. I don’t say that he should make a request concerning this.
speaker: Narrator

text: All unrighteousness is sin, and there is sin not leading to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that whoever is born of God doesn’t sin, but he who was born of God keeps himself, and the evil one doesn’t touch him.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that we are of God, and the whole world lies in the power of the evil one.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that the Son of God has come and has given us an understanding, that we know him who is true; and we are in him who is true, in his Son Jesus Christ. This is the true God and eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Little children, keep yourselves from idols.
speaker: Narrator
